svcsubproc.title: End Caps
svcsubproc.para: The bus body end caps if damaged can be removed and replaced ( Figure 53). The front cap and rear cap (End Caps) follow the same general procedure in the removal process.

step1.para: Due to the proximity and nature of the end cap removal, the driver windshield assembly must be removed. Follow the procedure as outlined in the windshield removal section of this manual.
Front cap requires removal of the outside rear view mirror. Depending on the type mirror, the drivers side rear view mirror may not require removal.

Loosen and remove the passenger side rear view mirror support brackets. Remove the rear view mirror assembly. If the mirror is equipped with optional heater accessories, disconnect the heater harness connection.
Loosen and remove the front or end cap warning lights and disconnect all electrical connections between the cap and the body.
Remove as many rivets from the front end drip rail as needed to free the front cap for removal.
Remove all remaining rivets that attach the cap to the body.
Follow the same general procedure for the rear end cap removal. The bus rear windows and emergency exit door need not be removed to remove the end cap.
